intro: Cissampelos rigidifolia, commonly known as the rigid leaf moonvine, is a climbing herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that are typically green when mature and turn red upon ripening. Its roots and leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties. Cissampelos rigidifolia thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests and along riverbanks.
